intro: Leandra mucida, commonly known as the pink hibiscus mosquito, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by hummingbirds and other pollinators. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
